title: Blended Learning Design and Implementation for Nursing Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing theory and practical experience
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment integrating in-person classes and online activities. Includes experimental approaches to validate the effectiveness of blended learning models for nursing undergraduates.

learning_goals: Learners can perform core nursing competencies (e.g., patient assessment, medication management, infection control) with at least 80% accuracy in a blended learning environment.
Learners independently analyze academic materials using an online learning platform (LMS) and participate in discussion forums at least twice weekly.

Learners create a comparative analysis table of the pros/cons of three blended learning models (flipped learning, blended learning, hybrid learning), propose at least two improvements considering applicability to nursing education, present the analysis in a team PPT (5â€“7 slides), and score over 2/3 points based on evaluation criteria (clarity, feasibility, innovativeness).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
